channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rotherwick Road outside number 2: Deep hole in red pavement tiling, raised pavement slabs, 16th October
item.description:
Overnight a deep rut in the tile edging appeared, alongside several paving stones raised from the earth. Appears as if very large truck reversed into the pavement. On a heavily used pavement leading to bus and tube station, hence of concern to many pedestrians

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rotherwick Road, Golders Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, 16th October
item.description:
Potholes commercial recycling containers keep getting stuck in the pothole putting driver at risk of manual handling injury

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 114-130, Powis Street, London

item.title: Tree felled and dumped in the park space, 16th October
item.description:
As part of Whitehall rec gardening group we spotted this felled tree. It looks like it was in the garden or alley of the adjoining house and then felled and the remains left in the park. You can see where the chain saw has cut into the fence. Not sure how long it has been there, but it is relatively new.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitehall Road, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin overflowing for some time now, 16th October
item.description:
This bin, just outside the foot tunnel, has been overflowing for more than a week. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 137, Westcombe Hill, East Greenwich, London

item.title: Regular fly tipping site, 16th October
item.description:
After the last pile sat for two weeks and was finally cleared, a new one had started only a couple of days later. Domestic rubbish and boxes. I think it might be the same people. I hope you catch them soon or that they learn how to sue bins. It’s disgusting

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anglesea Mews, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog excrement, 16th October
item.description:
Pathways on this street always have large amounts of dog excrement, particularly the south side section towards George Row. This is a health hazard. Please erect signs & cameras to deter or fine culprits.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chambers Street, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage to temporary bollard / post, 16th October
item.description:
The temporary bollard/post at the junction of Valley Road and Edward Street has been damaged. It was meant to be replaced with a permanent fixture but this has not yet happened.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Valley Road, New Cross, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown enormous LBB trees, 16th October
item.description:
The three enormous LBB trees are not maintained and the huge branches that hang over our back and front garden are now nearly touching our roof. We have advised you numerous times that these trees cause a lengthy list of problems, of which you have no regard. Would you prefer it if we go to the newshopper and they do an article on your ridiculous sized trees? Or are you going to maintenance them, like a responsible council would? When someone is hurt or property damaged you clearly will not care, after all it will just be another claim to you. What will it take for you to act? If these trees were next to your property would you be fine with that? Please give a date of when these trees will dealt with by a tree surgeon, that’s the least you could do.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Gravelwood Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet
